runs.comm: slowish bouncer outside off to start proceedings, Mahela thinks of the pull and then pulls out
short again, but this time enough width outside off for Mahela to free his arms and square cut it handsomely for four

wow, this man is in seriously awesome form! Back of good length outside off, Mahela steps out and drives elegantly high and handsome over long off for a six. Who said shots from the book are not useful in this format!
better length this time and outside off, Mahela gets forward and defends to the off side
straighter, drifts on to middle and leg, Mahela is on the front foot and tucks it away straight to the midwicket fielder

beautiful! Again, straying on to middle, but it was short of a length. Mahela got his front foot across and eased it with the wrists, in the air, but safely between mid on and midwicket for four. That shot was a lesson in timing!
slides down leg for a wide
short of a length, straightening from leg to middle, Dilshan gets back and punches down to long on
slightly fuller, angling in with the arm to leg stump and straightening, Mahela plays it to the leg side
similar ball, dealt with in similar fashion, but can't find the gap this time either
close! Hits Mahela's pads in front of leg and very nearly deflects on to off stump, but it misses and runs down towards third man
Seeya later! Drifts on to his pads again, Mahela pulls out the slog sweep, and is aided by the wind. A couple of seconds later, the ball landed a few rows behind deep square leg

gone, Dilshan's horror patch shows no sign of ending, and that shot said it all. Short of good length and straight, and Dilshan is not in the kind of form Mahela is, but still went through with the straight lofted drive. Timing was conspicuous by its absence, and it ballooned for an easy catch towards mid off.
full outside off, Mahela is sucked into the cover drive and checks it at the last moment. Goes straight to cover
back of a length, Mahela gets forward and opens the face, but cannot run it past point
slower ball slides down the leg side, and Mahela gets something on it, but good save from Taibu saves some runs
slow and high bouncer outside off, Mahela is not seeing it like a football, he is seeing it like a blimp. Rides the bounce and upper cuts it easily for a four, very fine in the third man region
drives the length ball on leg stump down to mid on for a single
short, and cut away fiercely, but very good save at point, diving to the left keeps it down to one
on to the left handers pads from over the wicket, worked away straight to mid on off the front foot
slightly shorter this time, Perera gets back and drives to mid on
on to the pads again, Perera gets something on itdown to short fine leg to turn the strike over
slides down the leg and Mahela lets it go for a wide
better line, angling on to middle and straightening, Mahela gets back and plays cautiously
pre-medidated lap sweep, executed well, but good fielding at short fine leg keeps it down to a single. Perera was lazy in getting across, but gets there easily in the end

Mahela does it again! Down the track, driven on the up, inside out for a big six over extra cover. The pitch is slow, the ball is not coming on to the bat etc., but Mahela is batting on a different planet altogether.
straighter this time, tucked away to midwicket for one

ooh, close run out opportunity, but the stumps were missed. Glanced away straight to short fine leg for a tight single and Mahela would have been out by a yard - so far it has looked like the only way he can be dismissed.

my oh my! Timing all the way! Similar ball to the one he hit for six, but this time, just for variety, he decided four would suffice, extends the arms and drives through the line over the head of extra cover and the ball purrs away to the boundary. It almost seemed happy to get there, when treated with such finesse and touch!
no, bowling short is not an option Mr. Elton, Mahela seemed to say as he rocked back and cut it fiercely through point and cover for four more!
short and turning in, Perera goes back and bunts it down to long on
short, but on middle, Mahela moves towards the leg side to cut it, and times it well again, but can't beat point
short again, and on leg stump, Mahela picked it so early and got into position to pull-swing it easily over midwicket
short again, he pulls it down to long leg to turn the strike over

rubbish bowling, and Perera gets into the act, just as well too - after all he is the designated pinch-hitter! Gets back to the short ball and cuts it well in front of square, along the carpet for four
finally, pitches it up and forces Perera to come forward. Flicked straight to midwicket
drifts with turn on to his pads, Mahela glances it behind square
good length, on to leg and straightening, played back to the bowler
similar ball, almost offers a return catch this time. Good bowling from Lamb
Perera breaks the strangle hold, he jumps out, gets close to the pitch and lofts it high and just over long on on the ropes. Mpofu tried to pull it in, but it was just beyond him.
drives down to long on this time to retain strike.
pitched well up on leg stump, Perera is down the track again, and drives powerfully down to long on who fumbles and concedes a second. Masakadza was the culprit
gets back this time and cuts it into the cover region
tries to cut again and gets a single
Mahela eases to a classic fifty, gets back and caresses it with the wrists to deep midwicket.
again flighten on leg, and Perera gets too close to it by coming down the track and drives it down to long on
shorter, drifting on to his pads, played down to mid on
turns on to Mahela's pads, he glances behind square leg

Whack! Flighted on Perera's pads and he has shown a liking for that particular line. Hittable length too and he obliged, freed his arms and sent it sailing high over long on for seemingly the biggest six of the day.

wonderful catch by Chigumbura in the deep to send Perera back! Full toss from Lamb, dealt with in violent fashion by Perera, who was again eyeing the long on boundary, but he could not get enough elevation this time. Chigumbura runs to his left from long on and takes it a couple of feet inside the ropes. Well taken!
length ball on middle and off, defended off front foot
shortens the length on to his pads, Sanga gets down the track and plays straight to midwicket
another delicate late cut from Mahela, gets forward and sends it behind square for a couple
goes for the sweep down on one knee, but cannot make proper contact
down the track to the good length ball, and tapped down to long on
Sanga dances down the track and takes it on the full, but drives it quietly down to wide long on
very short and wide, but Mahela is not in a violent mood today, so he just pats it towards deep point for one
full outside off, driven off the front foot to cover for a quick single
slight hint of turn, Sanga works it with the spin square on the off side for one
heaved away, with his trademark timing mid you, towards midwicket for a couple. Tumbling save on the boundary was required to deny him the four
another late cut, off a very full ball, he guides it comfortably, very fine
lofted towards cow corner, where Ervine puts in another fine tap the ball at the last moment back into the playing area to save the boundary
rocks back and bunts this down towards extra cover for one
good length ball, Sanga gets forward and defends to the off side
wide down the leg, looks to sweep and misses, as does Taibu, they run a single

Sanga will not get out to a poorer ball, how ever hard he tries! Rank long hop on middle, that sat up with the turn and asked to be deposited outside the ground, Sanga tried to pull it away and got a farcical top edge that lobbed straight up for a simple catch at short fine leg.
full on leg, turning and straightening, defended off the front foot
slightly shorter, Chandimal rocks back and drives it down to long on for one
on leg stump, tries to glance it away behind square
play and a miss down the leg side, and pad-less Taibu misses it too, they run an extra
comes down and drives along the ground down to long on for one
flat offie, going in with the angle on to the pads, played away to wide mid on
Dropped by Lamb at long on. Chandimal came down and lofted it and it was a sitter for Lamb, who dropped the dolly.

this is the non-violent movement from Jayawardene and it is working fine! He knows where the gaps are, waits on that short and wide ball and strokes another late cut, the ball goes into the gap behind square on the off and takes its time before reaching the ropes
pats it down to long on now to turn the strike over
Chandi-mauled! Jumps out of the crease and drives it high and straight for a huge six. Golf swing that one was.
this time he's found the fielder, and this time, the fielder has held on to the catch! Similar shot, down the track, towards long off, just not enough to clear the boundary and it was taken easily.
fligthed on the pads, gets it away to square leg for one
missed out there, wide down the leg and Mahela swept it straight to short fine leg
works this one away straight to short midwicket. Can't get the single
first time today that Mahela has been beaten, and it was a beautiful leggie too.. Spinning from leg to off, missing his attempted dab
slides a fraction down the leg this time
on leg stump, worked away towards midwicket to turn the strike over
good ball to finish a good over, leg spinner on middle stump, Angelo opens the face and guides it to point for a single
on the pads, worked away square for one
short and wide, Mahela makes room and cuts it away in front of square
ah, slides down the leg with the turn, harsh call for wide
short outside off, turning in, Angelo rocks back and bunts it down to long off
turns again from off to leg, Mahela plays with soft hands and runs hard for a couple
flight and a hint of turn, Mahela inside edges the big booming off drive and it runs down towards mid on
down the track and smashed straight back at the bowler, who picks up and throws it straight back. Good thing Angelo did not continue the rally.
seeya later! Flighted outside off, Mahela puts his front foot across and swings his bat a few degrees to send the ball flying high over long on.
pre-meditated lap sweep this time and again timed to a nicety, sending it very fine
misses out on the sweep this time, hits it straight to short fine leg
and this time, he bisects the gap perfectly! Swept, just to the left of short fine leg and to the right of the sweeper running across for four
glanced behind square for a single.
jumps out and yorks himself, but gets it down to square leg

gone! Mathews goes hard with the slog sweep, but can't time it half as well as his incredibly in-form partner at the other end, it lands in the hands of Erwine at midwicket who jumps at the right instant to pull it in. Great catch!
pitched up on middle, gets forward and drives down to long on
makes room and opens the face to send it hurtling at the pace it came down to third man. Lovely!
more finesse and elegance, he's just not stopping today! Swishes the wand with minimal fuss to send it flying towards wide long on. Does not help Zim's cause that it was a full toss
good low full toss, even Mahela the maestro can't get it away past midwicket
loses it this time and sends a waist-high full toss, that Mahela swings away to midwicket
another attempted yorker gone awry, knee high full toss on leg stump, swung away happily by Kapugedera over long leg.
goes for the pull, misses it and gets hit on the helmet, it balloons to short third man and they run a head-bye.
good yorker this, tailing in on middle and leg, Mahela looks to make room and square drive, but hits stright to point
another low full toss, swung away to deep midwicket for a single that will give Mahela the strike
down the track, short of a length, Mahela cross-bats it down to long off to move to 99

negative line, but positive shot! Left armer spinning it from over the wicket, outside leg stump, but Kapu is down the track and gets to the pitch to convert it into hittable length. Lofts it very high and it goes straight into the sight screen
tries to sweep and gets a leg bye to give Mahela the strike.

and that's that! We have been privileged to watch one of the highest quality innings you will see, in any format! Full on leg stump, driven serenely down to long on and it is three-figures for Mahela.

gone. It is on the pads and Kapu slog sweeps it in the air towards square leg, where Masakadza runs in and takes the catch. In the process, he puts his knee down and takes out a bit of the earth from the Providence outfield.

and at the end of the day, he proves he is human after all! Mahela jumps out again, looks to loft over long on and mis-hits one for the first time today. It makes contact high on the bat and goes straight up for a simple catch at long on. Please stand and applaud for this wonderful innings.
full toss on leg stump, driven down to long on. Can Sanath unleash some fury please.
short of a length outside off, guided feebly to cover and they run a cheeky couple
slow bouncer and Sanath is surprised, plays a feeble pull for a single
good yorker, following Malinga as he runs to the leg side, and he can't squeeze it out
short of a length outside off, cut away for a single
ain't happening. Sanath looks to pull the slow bouncer, it hits his body and balloons to Taibu, they run through as Taibu misses the stumps at the striker's end, and Malinga hares back for a second.
